member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.HttpBindingBase

member.summary: Specifies client authentication using NTLM.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurity
member.summary: Configures the security settings of a basicHttpBinding binding.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurity.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the security mode for a basicHttpBinding binding.
member.returns: A value in the enumeration. The default value for this property is .
member.exception: The value is not a legal value for .

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurity.Transport
member.summary: Gets the transport-level security settings for a basicHttpBinding binding.
member.returns: The transport-level security settings for a basicHttpBinding binding.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurityMode
member.summary: Specifies the types of security that can be used with the system-provided .

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurityMode.Message
member.summary: Security is provided using SOAP message security. For the , the system requires that the server certificate be provided to the client separately. The valid client credential types for this binding are UserName and Certificate.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurityMode.None
member.summary: The SOAP message is not secured during transfer. This is the default behavior.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurityMode.Transport
member.summary: Security is provided using HTTPS. The service must be configured with SSL certificates. The SOAP message is protected as a whole using HTTPS. The service is authenticated by the client using the service’s SSL certificate. The client authentication is controlled through the .

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurityMode.TransportCredentialOnly
member.summary: This mode does not provide message integrity and confidentiality. It provides only HTTP-based client authentication. Use this mode with caution. It should be used in environments where the transfer security is being provided by other means (such as IPSec) and only client authentication is provided by the Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) infrastructure.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurityMode.TransportWithMessageCredential
member.summary: Integrity, confidentiality and server authentication are provided by HTTPS. The service must be configured with a certificate. Client authentication is provided by means of SOAP message security. This mode is applicable when the user is authenticating with a UserName or Certificate credential and there is an existing HTTPS deployment for securing message transfer.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpsSecurity
member.summary: Specifies basic https security settings.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpsSecurity.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the security mode for a basicHttpsBinding binding.
member.returns: The security mode for a basicHttpsBinding binding.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpsSecurity.Transport
member.summary: Gets the transport-level security settings for a basicHttpsBinding binding.
member.returns: The transport-level security settings for a basicHttpsBinding binding.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpsSecurityMode
member.summary: Specifies the basic https security mode.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpsSecurityMode.Transport
member.summary: The Transport security mode.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpsSecurityMode.TransportWithMessageCredential
member.summary: The TransportWithMessageCredential security mode.
